titleInfo.title: Letter from John MacLeod, Resident in the Persian Gulf, to Captain Hardy, Senior Officer of Marine in the Gulf of Persia

mods.abstract: The letter informs Hardy that MacLeod has received native reports of an attack on a Bahrain boat and it would appear that the attackers were 'Bedowins [Bedouins] of the desert' who had taken possession of a fishing boat on the coast between Ras Reean [?] and Bidow [?]. He writes that he has written to the Agent at Bahrain on the subject and that every enquiry should be made into the affair to prevent its recurrence. He states that the Shaikh of Bahrain should be held responsible for the coast that is subject to him, but doubts that his authority extends inland.
